channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: xAI says it raised $20B in Series E funding
item.description: Nvidia is among the many investors, but xAI has not disclosed if these investments come in the form of equity or debt.

item.title: California lawmaker proposes a four-year ban on AI chatbots in kids’ toys
item.description: “Our children cannot be used as lab rats for Big Tech to experiment on,” Senator Steve Padilla said. He just introduced a bill to ban AI chatbots in t...

item.title: LMArena lands $1.7B valuation four months after launching its product
item.description: LMArena, which started as a UC Berkeley research project, has raised about $250 million total and become a unicorn in about seven months.

item.title: Amazon’s Ring doorbells get fire alerts, an app store and new sensors
item.description: The new Ring Sensors can detect motion, openings, glass breakage, and smoke, and can also monitor carbon monoxide levels, leaks, temperature changes, ...

item.title: The most bizarre tech announced so far at CES 2026
item.description: From an AI panda pet to an anime girl hologram for your desk, here are the wildest products at CES 2026.

item.title: Intel is building a handheld gaming platform including a dedicated chip
item.description: Intel has been building chips designed for gaming PCs for years but the company is now moving into handheld devices too.

item.title: ‘Industry’ Takes on the Age Verification Wars
item.description: In the HBO show’s fourth season, Industry proves to be more prescient than it’s ever been.

item.title: Steve Jobs’ Early Apple Items Are Going Up for Auction—Along With His Bow Ties
item.description: Some of the objects came from Steve Jobs’ childhood bedroom. They’re being made available by his stepbrother, John Chovanec.

item.title: Meta pauses international expansion of its Ray-Ban Display glasses
item.description: Meta had originally planned to launch the glasses in France, Italy, Canada, and the U.K. in early 2026.

item.title: Ring and Watch Duty Team Up to Keep a Closer Eye on Wildfires
item.description: In a move to help alert people to the spread of nearby blazes, Ring is partnering with Watch Duty to let users share their videos on the wildfire trac...
